channel.title: Homes on Isaque Pimentel
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Isaque Pimentel

item.description: My name is Isaque Pimentel and I am currently a Ph.D. student at École Polytechnique. My main research interests are Stochastic Control and Monte Carlo methods applied to Mathematical Finance. I am a candidate to a Ph.D in Applied Mathematics from the Centre de Mathématiques Appliquées (CMAP). I am sponsored by CIFRE contract with EDF R&D at Optimisation Simulation Risk and Statistics (OSIRIS) department. My advisor is Professor Emmanuel Gobet, coordinator of the Statistique Apprentissage Simulation Image (SIMPAS) research team.

item.title: Talks
item.description: Option valuation and hedging using asymmetric risk function (poster). September, 2018. ANR CAESARS, Palaiseau, France. Asymptotic non-linear continuous-time valuation with hedging and asymmetric risk function (poster). November, 2017. Research in Options, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Hedging with non-quadratic local risk minimization using least-squares Monte-Carlo. July, 2017. International Conference on Monte Carlo Methods and Applications, Montréal, Canada.

item.title: Events
item.description: 2018 - Advances in Modelling and Control for Power Systems of the Future (ANR CAESARS Conference). EDF Lab Paris-Saclay, Palaiseau, France. 2018 - 11th European Summer School in Financial Mathematics. Ecole Polytechnique, Paris, France. ISC-PIF, Paris, France. -- 2018 - PhD Winter School on Real Options and Commodity Markets. NTNU, Tauplitz, Austria. 2018 - 17th Winter School on Mathematical Finance. De Werelt, Luteren, Netherlands.

item.title: Custom Section
item.description: This is an example of using the custom widget to create your own homepage section. To remove this section, either delete content/home/teaching.md or edit the frontmatter of the file to deactivate the widget by setting active = false.
